ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: My child is sensitive and gets bothered by smells that don't seem to bother other people.
My child is sensitive or bothered by sounds that don't seem to bother other people.
My child is bothered by looking down a long flight of stairs or going down an escalator.
My child gets car sick.
My child is sensitive to movement. S/he gets dizzy very easily.
My child is sensitive to and bothered by lights/contrasts/reflections or objects close to his/her face (that don't seem to bother others).
My child is bothered by some food textures in his/her mouth (or avoids them).
It bothers my child to be barefoot on grass or sand.
My child is bothered by tags and labels in his/her clothes (or tags are removed).
My child is bothered by turtleneck shirts, tight fitting clothes, elastic, nylons, or synthetic material in clothes (any of the above).
My child is bothered by the feeling of jewelry (or never wears it because of this).
My child is very aware that certain parts of his/her body are very sensitive.
My child avoids having creams and lotions put on his/her skin because of how it feels.
My child has a sensitive scalp.
My child does not like being in crowded areas such as elevators, malls, subways, or crowded shops (or I never put him/her in these situations).
My child does not like to be hugged (except by mother).
My child is bothered when someone touches him/her from behind or unexpectedly, or stands too close.
My child is very active.
My child has mood swings more than other children.
My child does not go to sleep easily and wake up easily and/or s/he doesn't sleep between 6 and 8 hours each night.
I consider my child to be anxious.
It is important for my child to be in control and know what to expect.
My child is a perfectionist, or compulsive.
Child Sensory Questionnaire: Total
Child Sensory Questionnaire: Sensitivity Subscore
My child avoids, if at all possible, situations in which his/her senses will be stressed.
Visit name
